page.title: 03INTERESTING PEOPLE
page.content: Mrs Hardy and Mrs Beaumount came in to tell us what Cotgrave was like.Church Lane was called Pepper Street in the olden days because in those days they didn't bury people very deep,so it smelt and the people that went past took a handkerchief with pepper in and that is why it is called Pepper Street.They had toilets which were a wooden seat and a hole and a pan at the bottom.They also danced round the maypole in the Rector's garden and they had flower shows. We had to go to Bingham to do the baking and they used shells to count with.The school had two playgrounds one for the boys and one for the girls.In the first class you wrote on sand ,in the next class you wrote on slate and in the top class you wrote on paper.They had a sports day as well.
